alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 3:40PM MST until June 29 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Portions of the Grand Canyon in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 645 PM MST. * At 338 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Grand Canyon. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly with flow into the Colorado River HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cape Royal At Grand Canyon, Moran Point At Grand Canyon, Shoshone Point At Grand Canyon, Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, Grand Canyon National Park and Grand Canyon Village. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chuar Creek, Grapevine Creek, Clear Creek, Garden Creek, Pipe Creek, Bright Angel Wash, Hance Creek, Cardenas Creek, Comanche Creek, Cremation Creek, Bright Angel Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Unkar Creek and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
